summary.para: The Clone method makes a copy of the enumerator. The returned object starts with the same enumeration state as the original.

param.name: ppEnum
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the new enumerator. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: The pin's state has changed and is now inconsistent with the enumerator.

remarks.para: If the set of media types changes, the enumerator is no longer consistent with the pin, and the method returns VFW_E_ENUM_OUT_OF_SYNC. Discard any data obtained from previous calls to the enumerator, because it might be invalid. Update the enumerator by calling the method. You can then call the Clone method safely.

summary.para: The Next method retrieves a specified number of media types.

param.name: cMediaTypes
param.para: The number of media types to retrieve.

param.name: ppMediaTypes
param.para: The address of an array of pointers. The number of elements in the array is given in the cMediaTypes parameter.

param.name: pcFetched
param.para: Receives the number of media types returned in ppMediaTypes. This parameter can be NULL if cMediaTypes is 1.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: Did not retrieve as many media types as requested.
The pin's state has changed and is now inconsistent with the enumerator.

remarks.para: The caller passes an array of pointers in ppMediaTypes. The method allocates a number AM_MEDIA_TYPE structures equal to cMediaTypes or to the number of media types that remain in the enumeration, whichever is less. The number of structures allocated is returned in pcFetched. Delete each structure by calling the DeleteMediaType function.

If the set of media types changes, the enumerator becomes inconsistent with the owning pin. In that case, the method returns VFW_E_ENUM_OUT_OF_SYNC. Discard any data obtained from previous calls to the enumerator, because it might be invalid. Update the enumerator by calling the method. You can then call the Next method safely.

summary.para: The Reset method resets the enumeration sequence to the beginning.
The Skip method skips over a specified number of media types.

param.name: cMediaTypes
param.para: Number of media types to skip.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: Skipped past the end of the sequence.
The pin's state has changed and is now inconsistent with the enumerator.

remarks.para: If the set of media types changes, the enumerator is no longer consistent with the pin, and the method returns VFW_E_ENUM_OUT_OF_SYNC. Discard any data obtained from previous calls to the enumerator, because it might be invalid. Update the enumerator by calling the method. You can then call the Skip method safely.

summary.para: The IEnumMediaTypes interface enumerates a pin's preferred media types. To obtain this interface, call the method on the pin. Filters use this interface when they connect to other filters. Applications can also use it to examine a pin's preferred media types. For more information, see Enumerating Objects in a Filter Graph.
This interface implements a standard Component Object Model (COM) collection object.
If a pin's set of preferred media types changes, some methods on this interface return VFW_E_ENUM_OUT_OF_SYNC. Call the method to resynchronize the enumerator.
